summary: The project manager had the team members re-introduce themselves and then briefed the team on his own duties and on the meeting agenda. The industrial designer discussed the interior workings of a remote and the team discussed options for batteries and infra-red signals. The user interface designer discussed what features the remote was required to have and presented two existing products which were based on different concepts. The project manager then introduced some new requirements to bear in mind when designing the remote. The marketing expert presented research on consumer preferences on remotes in general and on voice recognition and the team discussed the option to have an ergonomically designed remote. The project manager briefed the team on the decisions made so far and the team discussed color options for the remote.
actions: The project manager will consult with the legal department to discuss the prevention of lawsuits from consumers claiming the remote caused RSI
decisions: The remote will use regular batteries. The corporate image will be displayed on the remote. The remote will not contain a voice activation feature. The remote will have an ergonomic design. The remote will use a regular infra-red signal.
problems: How powerful the infra-red signal should be. Whether the remote should have a locking function. Whether to include a voice activation feature in the remote. If the remote should have an ergonomic design. What color the remote should be.

------=_NextPart_000_0006_01C50942.0481E3C0-- ES2007docs.ES2007scen.participant1hBcPresentationKickOff..1.ppt ------------ Kick-Off meeting Presented by: , Project Manager Agenda Opening Acquaintance Tool training Project plan Discussion Closing (we have 25 minutes!) Project Aim New remote control Original Trendy User friendly Project Method Functional design Individual work Meeting Conceptual design Individual work Meeting Detailed design Individual work Meeting Tool Training Try out whiteboard! Every participant should draw their favorite animal and sum up their favorite characteristics of that animal Project Finance Selling price: 25 euro Profit aim: 50 M euro Market range: international Production costs: max. 12.50 euro Discussion Examples: Experience with remote control First ideas new remote Etc. Closing Next meeting starts in 30 minutes Individual actions ID: the working design UID: the technical functions design ME: the user requirements specification Specific instructions will be sent to you by your personal coach. ES2007docs.ES2007scen.participant2hBcComponents_design..2.ppt ------------ Components Design Presented by: Catherine Canevet, Industrial Designer RR Energy source a basic battery a hand dynamo a kinetic provision of energy use of solar cells Cases general case: uncurved (flat) more original case: single curved or even double curved Case material supplements Plastic, Latex (won't allow the use of solar cells as energy source), rubber (used in anti-RSI stress balls), wood, and titanium (can't use the titanium for the double curved cases) Push buttons scroll wheels with optional integrated push button (such as in the modern computer mouse), liquid crystal displays (LCD) multiple scroll buttons Note: if you use a rubber double curved case, you must use rubber push buttons. Electronics Simple (push buttons), Regular (scroll wheel higher price range), advanced chip on print. The chip on print includes an infrared sender. (display, again more expensive) RR have just developed a sample sensor/ sample speaker. ES2007docs.ES2007scen.participant2hBcWorking_design..2.ppt ------------ Working Design Presented by: Catherine Canevet, Industrial Designer Components The idea: Infrared bulb Bulb Switch Energy source Wire Chip Subcomponent Energy source: 2 RL6 batteries. Infrared bulb. ES2007docs.ES2007scen.participant3hBcInterface_concept..2.ppt ------------ Interface Concept Presented by: Gabriel, User Interface Designer Method Consulted our manufacturing division Took Reissas marketing findings into consideration Real Reaction has pioneered some new interface components that might be applicable to our remote Some of these new interfaces have been used in other products, e.g. coffee machine Findings Speech recognition interface currently used with new RR coffee machine Sample sensor/sample output We could use spinning wheel w/ LC display as in iPod We could consider a niche remote, geared either towards kids (e.g. bright colors, playful keys) or towards the elderly (e.g. giant and impossible to lose) Findings, Continued Key layout and design are crucial so that users arent always pressing the wrong key, e.g. up volume instead of down volume. I neglected to mention that we need a power button Personal Preferences Speech recognition is quite limited, e.g. it only provides a verbal answer to a question Rather than niche market, I think we should continue our plan of making a good general remote No spinning wheel, LC display ES2007docs.ES2007scen.participant3hBcTechnical_functions..4.ppt ------------ Technical Functions Design Presented by: Gabriel, User Interface Designer Method Looked for inspiration from existing remotes People will want something that is familiar So we can take what is familiar and perfect that Improve existing designs; maintain basic functionality Findings There are some basic functions that must be included: Volume control Numerical keys Channel keys Mute Personal Preferences There is a dichotomy of engineering-centered and user-centered remotes The former provides a lot of functionality but the latter emphasizes ease of use My preference is for the latter, i.e. centered on ease of use Question for marketing guru: how much will this cost us in profits, or will it? ES2007docs.ES2007scen.participant4hBcEvaluation..1.ppt ------------ Evaluation criteria Presented by: Reissa, Marketing Expert Method Evaluate each criteria on a scale of 1-7. 1-true, 7-false. Criteria's Look and feel: Does the remote look cool and fashionable? Does it feel spongy? New Technology Easy to use Cost Amount of buttons: Contain only the necessary buttons. RSI Getting lost Evaluation Criteria rating with seven-point scale Look at white board. ES2007docs.ES2007scen.participant4hBcFunctional_requirements..1.ppt ------------ Functional Requirements Presented by: Reissa Hainsworth, Market Expert Method Observed remote control users in a usability lab. The participants were also asked to fill out questionnaires. Total number of people tested was 100. Findings 75% of users find the remote control ugly 80% of users would spend more money if the remote look fancy Current remote controls do not match well the operating behaviour of the user 50% of users say that they only use 10% of the buttons on the remote. 75% users say they Zap It takes to much time to learn how to use a new remote Remotes often get lost in the room. Personal Preferences Easy to use especially for older people who find it difficult to learn new things. Looks really cool/flash and groovy!!!! Easy to find. ES2007docs.ES2007scen.participant4hBcTrend_watching..2.ppt ------------ Trend Watching Presented by: Marketing Expert Method From looking at this years trends and fashions. And, from the recent investigation of the remote control market. Findings from remote control market. Most important aspect: Looks and feels fancier that the existing remote controls. Second important aspect: the Remote control should be Technologically innovative. The third most important aspect: the remote control is easy to use. Finding in the fashion industry. Next years fashion: Fruit and vegetables are the most important theme for cloths shoes and furniture. The feel of material which is IN this year is SPONGY Personal Preferences Move away from the current remote controls look and feel. Change the look and the feel while still keeping to the companies image.
